isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Engine Electrical Components - Removal - Electrical Components - Chassis Mounted

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting any electrical components.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not tug on the engine sensor wiring harness while trying to remove it. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

figure.caption: ECM and IDM harness recess connections

step1.para: Disconnect three IDM wiring harness connectors.
Disconnect four ECM wiring harness connectors (two for engine and two for chassis).

figure.caption: ECM and IDM assembly mounting bolts

step1.para: Remove the IDM and ECM components by loosening and removing four nuts and washers from the mounting bolts.
Remove the ECM and IDM components from the engine.

figure.caption: Removing the IDM from the ECM

step1.para: Separate the ECM and IDM by loosening four (M8 x 70) bolts. Remove the bolts, nuts, and washers from the components and separate.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the EGR valve drive module.
Remove the two mounting bolts securing the EGR drive module.
Remove the EGR drive module.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not tug on any sensor wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

note.para: There are two relays located next to the fuse box. The taller relay is the intake air heater relay. The shorter relay is the glow plug relay.

calloutgroup.callout1: Glow plug relay main connection post

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting any electrical components.

step1.para: Verify the main battery negative terminal has been disconnected.
Remove ground lead from the ground connection post 1 .
Loosen nut and remove battery lead from battery connection post 2 .
Loosen nuts and remove both glow plug harness leads from glow plug relay main connection post 3 and glow plug control post 4 .
Loosen nut and remove diagnostic lead from diagnostic connection post 3 .

calloutgroup.callout1: Prevailing torque hex flange nuts M6 (2)

step1.para: Loosen and remove the two nuts 1 securing the glow plug relay 2 to the support bracket.
Remove glow plug relay 2 from the support bracket.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not tug on any sensor wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

note.para: There are two relays located next to the fuse box. The taller relay is the intake air heater relay. The shorter relay is the glow plug relay.

calloutgroup.callout1: Intake air heater control connection post
Intake air heater relay main connection post

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting any electrical components.

step1.para: Verify the main battery negative terminal has been disconnected.
Loosen and remove battery lead from battery connection post 1 .
Loosen and remove air intake lead from air intake control post 2 .
Loosen and remove ground lead from ground connection post 3 .
Loosen and remove intake air heater relay main lead from connection post 4 .
Loosen and remove diagnostic lead from post 4 .

figure.caption: Intake air heater relay mounting connections

calloutgroup.callout1: Prevailing torque hex flange nut M6, (2)

step1.para: Loosen and remove the two nuts 1 securing the intake air heater relay to the support bracket.
Remove intake air heater relay 2 from the support bracket.
